report.report_text:
[Report de-identified (Safe-harbor compliant) by De-ID v.6.22.07.0]
HISTORY: This is a **AGE[in 70s]-year-old female patient who was admitted because of gingivitis and abscess gums. The reason for the GU consult is urinary incontinence. This patient has seen Dr. **NAME[VVV] before for urinary incontinence, and she had two bladder suspensions which helped in initial success, failed according to the patient. The patient now is having mixed-type incontinence, has urgency as well as stress incontinence. It appears; however, that the main component is urge incontinence. The patient wears diapers.
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: Includes multiple medical problems including:
1. Morbid obesity. 2. Diabetes mellitus type 2. 3. Bronchial asthma. 4. Old stroke. 5. Knee replacement. 6. Chronic back pain. 7. Hypertension. 8. Osteoporosis. 9. Degenerative joint disease.
MEDICATIONS: 1. Methocarbamol. 2. Flexeril. 3. Amitriptyline. 4. Lyrica. 5. Plavix. 6. Indapamide. 7. Nexium. 8. Singulair. 9. Glyburide. 10. Prandin. 11. Baby aspirin.
ALLERGIES: None.
SOCIAL HISTORY: An ex-smoker. She does not drink.
REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: CONSTITUTIONAL: The patient feels weak, and she has loss of appetite and decreased ability to ambulate. The patient is morbidly obese. RESPIRATORY: No coughing. No dyspnea. CARDIOVASCULAR: No chest pain. No palpitations. GI: No change in bowel habits. GU: See history of present illness.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: VITAL SIGNS: Pulse is 98 per minute, blood pressure is 140/77, and respiratory rate is 22 per minute. HEAD, EYES, EARS, NOSE, AND THROAT: Negative. NECK: Supple. LUNGS: Clear. HEART: Normal sinus rhythm. No murmur. ABDOMEN: Soft and nontender. Bowel sounds present. EXTREMITIES: The patient has redness of both lower extremities. NEUROLOGICAL: Deferred.
LABORATORY FINDINGS: White blood count 10.7, hemoglobin 11.4, hematocrit 34.9, serum creatinine 0.9, and blood glucose over 200.
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN: The patient appears to have severe overactive bladder syndrome. We will check urine for infection. We will start the patient on anticholinergics.
______________________________ **NAME[WWW M XXX], M.D.
HS Job # 808259 / 41124 / # **ID-NUM D: **DATE[May 18 2007] 16:05 T: **DATE[May 19 2007] 21:13
